issue.title: [Python] Allow user to select compression level in pyarrow.parquet.write_table
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6353](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6353). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This feature was introduced for C++ in [ARROW-6216](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6216).

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6353?focusedCommentId=16915645) by Martin Radev (martinradev):*
[~Igor Yastrebov] 
Should I work on this?
I would be a bit slow but I would be interested in doing it from a learning experience standpoint.

Isn't the priority a bit too high? The change to the Parquet/Arrow C++ API doesn't break the python layer.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6353?focusedCommentId=16916694) by Igor Yastrebov (Igor Yastrebov):*
`[~martinradev]`

You are free to work on it if you want. I'd love to see this feature in 0.15.0 but since I won't do it myself I'm in no position to ask for it.

 

As far as I'm concerned, there are only two levels of priority - blocker and non-blocker - but jira admins can correct it if it is a problem.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6353?focusedCommentId=16933582) by Martin Radev (martinradev):*
I started working on it.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6353?focusedCommentId=16935411) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 5446
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5446>
